data.title: Alphabet's Self-Driving Subsidiary Waymo Raises $2.25B In First External Funding
data.text: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG) subsidiary Waymo has raised $2.25 billion in its first external investment round, it announced Monday.

data.title: Waymo Includes Outsiders in $2.25 Billion Investment Round
data.text: Alphabet’s self-driving unit, a pioneer in autonomous vehicle research, has been expanding its commercial efforts.

data.title: Facebook, Google and Adobe pull out of more conferences as coronavirus spreads
data.text: Facebook, Google and Adobe on Monday announced their decisions to cancel, alter and pull out of various upcoming conferences due to the spreading of the coronavirus.

data.title: Self-driving car company Waymo raises $2.25 billion in first external round of funding
data.text: Waymo, the self-driving arm of Google's parent company Alphabet, announced Monday that it has raised $2.25 billion in its first external round of funding. And, it said, it expects to raise even more money as it looks to scale and expand its business.

data.title: Google cancels Cloud Next because of coronavirus
data.text: Google today announced that it is canceling the physical part of Cloud Next, its cloud-focused event and its largest annual conference by far with around 30,000 attendees, over concerns around the current spread of COVID-19.

data.title: Google's self-driving sister, Waymo, gets first outside investors
data.text: Waymo, the self-driving unit of Alphabet Inc , said on Monday it had raised $2.25 billion in its first external investment round and expects to add more outside investors.

data.title: Google says its cloud conference will only be held virtually as coronavirus spreads
data.text: The cloud conference drew in 30,000 attendees last year in San Francisco.

data.title: Waymo launches delivery service after raising $2.25 billion
data.text: Waymo CEO John Krafcik called it a natural extension of the autonomous drive technology the company has been testing outside of Phoenix.

data.title: Waymo brings in $2.25 billion from outside investors, Alphabet
data.text: Waymo, the former Google self-driving car project that is now a business under Alphabet, said Monday it raised $2.25 billion in a fundraising round led by Silver Lake, Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, and Mubadala Investment Company. This is the company’s first external investment, which also included Magna, Andreessen Horowitz, and AutoNation and its parent […]

data.title: Waymo Raises $2.25 Billion In First Funding Round With Non-Alphabet Backers, Including Silver Lake And Andreesen Horowitz
data.text: The move comes as the company accelerates R&D and expands its robotaxi and robotruck fleets.

data.text: Waymo, the self-driving unit of Alphabet Inc , said on Monday it has raised $2.25 billion in its first external investment round.

data.title: Alphabet's self-driving car company Waymo raises a whopping $2.25 billion in first external funding round
data.text: Silicon Valley firms like Silver Lake invested in Waymo's massive round.

data.title: Alphabet's latest moonshot project wants to individually track fish to help feed humanity
data.text: Alphabet's division X announced its latest moonshot project, called Tidal, in an effort to preserve ocean life and help feed humanity.
